newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SASOL FORMS GLOBAL GAS TECHNOLOGY ALLIANCE.
newsitem.headline: SASOL FORMS GLOBAL GAS TECHNOLOGY ALLIANCE.

text.p: South Africa's Sasol Ltd said on Wednesday its Sasol Technology unit had formed a global gas technology alliance with four international companies to develop new technology for the conversion of natural gas to synthesis gas.
Synthesis gas is the fundamental building block for the production of liquid fuels and chemicals.
Sasol said in a statement the four other members of the newly formed alliance were Amoco Production Company , British Petroleum , Praxair Inc and Norwegian oil and gas company Statoil.
The alliance members would share costs and contribute technical expertise and research development resources.

"They will combine their financial capabilities to develop critical areas and cross-licence technology rights to expeditiously and aggressively move this technology towards commercialisation," the company said.
It said a unique aspect of the new technology was the use of a ceramic membrane to combine oxygen separation from air with the partial oxidation of methane, in a single unit.
"This will eliminate the need for a separate oxygen production plant and will significantly reduce the energy and capital cost associated with synthesis gas production."
